intro: Veronica teberdensis, commonly known as the Teberdinsk bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are bell-shaped, giving it a delicate appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
